Detailed Description

Implements the Morrowind terrain using the Ogre Terrain Component

Each terrain cell is split into four blocks as this leads to an increase in performance and means we don't hit splat limits quite as much

int MWRender::TerrainManager::getLtexIndexAt ( int  cellX,
int  cellY,
int  x,
int  y 
) [private]

Gets a LTEX index at the given point, assuming the current cell starts at (0,0). This supports getting values from the surrounding cells so negative x, y is acceptable

Parameters:
cellX the coord of the cell
cellY the coord of the cell
x,y the splat position of the ltex index to get relative to the first splat of the current cell

Due to the fact that Ogre terrain doesn't support vertex colours we have to generate them manually

Creates the blend (splatting maps) for the given terrain from the ltex data.

void MWRender::TerrainManager::initTerrainTextures ( Ogre::Terrain::ImportData *  terrainData,
int  cellX,
int  cellY,
int  fromX,
int  fromY,
int  size,
std::map< uint16_t, int > &  indexes 
) [private]

Setups up the list of textures for part of a cell, using indexes as an output to create a mapping of MW LtexIndex to the relevant terrain layer

Parameters:
terrainData the terrain data to setup the textures for
cellX the coord of the cell
cellY the coord of the cell
fromX the ltex index in the current cell to start making the texture from
fromY the ltex index in the current cell to start making the texture from
size the size (number of splats) to get
indexes a mapping of ltex index to the terrain texture layer that can be used by initTerrainBlendMaps
